page.title: 17Village housing-concerns
page.content: Lack of new housing in the village is of great local concern. Present Local Authority plans only allow for infilling within the existing boundaries of the village. This type of housing is generally of the more expensive type and is therefore commonly sold to people in their midlife with existing, frequently teenage, children. The effect is that the number on roll at the local school has steadily declined. Young adults leaving home have to move out of the village to buy their first house. The trend towards an older and more affluent population puts stress upon local amenities. The local Parish Council would like a new development of twenty to thirty houses suitable for first time buyers, to revitalise the village without changing ng its character.
